args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor the Shadow of the Mukuroshu event.
Momoyo calls from the great beyond. However,\nthe voice of my departed wife does not reach me.
Caster fire and screams...\nThe sounds of my crimes drown out her call.
*pant* *pant* Even within my dreams, it\nis impossible to exchange words with her.
Rise and shine, Saiga.\nYou look like hell.
I am fine. What need have you?
The wyrmclan leaders want to have a\nword with you. It's about the Mukuroshu.
Quite the gathering we have here today.\nIt's not often you get this many of\nHinomoto's upper crust in one place.

The Mukuroshu plot the downfall of the
shogunate, making them our enemies.
The tales of a man who walked among
them are valuable to us.

We have heard from Yachiyo of how they
tempted you. Hoping to be reunited with
your departed wife, you stained your hands
with murder on their behalf.
Where did you lay hands on that\nmanacaster?
The Mukuroshu loaned it to me.\nI took it with me when I left them.
I see. But something yet eludes me.\nManacasters were uncovered and put\ninto use by the third scion of Alberia.
Mine was also made usable because of the\ninformation that leaked out of Chanzelia.

From what I'm hearing, your little divorce
with the Mukuroshu came before casters
were put into use. Something doesn't
quite add up.
Manacaster tech was independently\nconveyed to the Mukuroshu prior to its\nadoption in the south of the continent.
I have participated in hunting the\nMukuroshu for a while now, but I've\nnever heard of anything like that.
They must keep it well-concealed.\nNo doubt it's one of their trump cards.
I've seen one of their workshops.\nIt was full of people and equipment alike.

Still, it would be impossible for them to
make a manacaster. They strained to their
limits just to restore the ones they pilfered
from ancient ruins.

When I was with them, I happened to
overhear that they were developing new
weapons based on the manacasters at their
smithy.
Then the answer is an assault!\nWe raid their workshop!
There are a multitude of traps around\nthe mountain where the facilities are.\nTo attack straight-on is folly.
Better, then, that we send a small,\nadaptable force to evade the traps.
And who will spearhead this operation?
I have a firm grasp of the traps' locations,\nas well as the secret path to the smithy.
You're saying you will go? You, who is not\na leader of one of the twelve wyrmclans?
You'll need a guide. Further, the\nMukuroshu are not only my enemies,\nbut my sister-in-law Yachiyo's as well.
Your familiarity with the lay of the land\nand our foe's affairs would indeed make\nyou a heartening ally.
I make this request of you then, Saiga.\nSeize the Mukuroshu's crafting facilities\nalongside the force we select.
Both of you, stop.\nThere are fiends afoot.
Hm? Ah... I sense them too. It's some ways\nahead, but there the damned things are.
I've long had faith in my eyesight. But\nthere are still traps, so we can't\ncircumvent them.
Then we cut right through them.
That caster has considerable firepower.\nIt must take extraordinary skill to suppress\nthe recoil and hit your targets true.
Saiga is a good man to have at our backs.
He's not just skilled with a caster—guy's\ngot a steady head and unwavering resolve.
Really doesn't strike me as the type who'd\nfall so far from the path of the righteous.
Hm. This chamber is totally empty as well.
Was this really a Mukuroshu facility?\nIt's a ghost town.
There is a thin coating of dust about.\nIt would appear they have relocated.
Are there any indications as to where?
None. But look at that wall.
There's a map of southern Grastaea on it.

Several mining areas are marked.
If they're going to set up a workshop,
they would want it to be close to a place
with mineral deposits for making steel.

I see. Maybe they feel safer toiling away
on weapons in the South rather than
remaining beneath the noses of the
Twelve Wyrmclans in Hinomoto.
But the map is marked in several spots.\nHow are we to pinpoint the place they\nmoved to?
?! Was that the sound of caster fire?!
What?! Where'd you hear it from?
He can't have escaped this room.\nHow'd I lose sight of him?
Curious. What is this barrel?\nIt's...affixed with an onmyoji talisman?
Judging from the smell, there's oil inside.\nNo, it's a bo—!
